tactics.name: Reconnaissance
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather information they can use to plan future operations.

tactics.name: Resource Development
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to establish resources they can use to support operations.

tactics.name: Initial Access
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

tactics.name: Execution
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

tactics.name: Persistence
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

tactics.name: Privilege Escalation
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

tactics.name: Defense Evasion
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

tactics.name: Credential Access
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

tactics.name: Discovery
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

tactics.name: Lateral Movement
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

tactics.name: Collection
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.

tactics.name: Command and Control
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems.

tactics.name: Exfiltration
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

tactics.name: Impact
tactics.description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.
techniques.detection: Monitor executed commands and arguments. Look for unusual patterns in command-line activity.

mitigations.name: Execution Prevention
mitigations.description: Use application control to prevent execution.

techniques.name: PowerShell
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse PowerShell commands and scripts for execution.
techniques.detection: Monitor PowerShell execution and command parameters. Enable PowerShell logging.

mitigations.name: Antivirus/Antimalware
mitigations.description: Use AV to detect malicious PowerShell.

techniques.name: Valid Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts.
techniques.detection: Monitor authentication logs for unusual access patterns, multiple failed attempts, and privilege escalations.

techniques.name: Phishing
techniques.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.
techniques.detection: Monitor email gateways for suspicious attachments and links. Analyze email metadata and content.

mitigations.name: User Training
mitigations.description: Train users to identify phishing attempts.

techniques.name: Application Layer Protocol
techniques.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection.
techniques.detection: Monitor network traffic for unusual protocols or destinations. Analyze packet contents.

mitigations.name: Network Intrusion Prevention
mitigations.description: Use IPS to detect and block malicious traffic.

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over a different protocol than the existing command and control channel.
techniques.detection: Monitor for uncommon data flows. Analyze network protocols and data transfer patterns.

techniques.name: System Information Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system and hardware.
techniques.detection: Monitor process and command-line activity for actions that gather system information.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task/Job
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality to facilitate persistence or privilege escalation.
techniques.detection: Monitor scheduled task creation and modification. Look for unusual tasks or tasks created by suspicious processes.

mitigations.name: User Account Management
mitigations.description: Limit accounts that can create tasks.

techniques.name: Account Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of valid accounts.
techniques.detection: Monitor processes and command-line arguments for account enumeration activities.

techniques.name: Brute Force
techniques.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts.
techniques.detection: Monitor authentication logs for multiple failed login attempts from same source.

mitigations.name: Multi-factor Authentication
mitigations.description: Require MFA to mitigate brute force.
